GOD.content: gift as gift w/out essence, can’t be seen in light of day, must be the secret, secrecy is the last word of the gift which is the last word of the secret
GOD.linkedContent: gift as gift w/out essence, can’t be seen in light of day, must be the secret, secrecy is the last word of the gift which is the last word of the secret

GT.content: something must come about in an instant, an instant that doesn’t belong to economy of time, time w/out time, a forgetting that forgets, but a forgetting that’s not nothing
GT.linkedContent: something must come about in an instant, an instant that doesn’t belong to economy of time, time w/out time, a forgetting that forgets, but a forgetting that’s not nothing

GT.content: khrema signals in direction of monetary sign; w/ “Counterfeit Money” we’re at heart of truth w/out truth, law w/out law, duty w/out duty concentrated & lost in enigma of khrē, khrema, khraomai: one must, need, lack, desire, be indigent poor, owe, ought, need, utility, interest, thing, event, fatality, prayer
GT.linkedContent: khrema signals in direction of monetary sign; w/ “Counterfeit Money” we’re at heart of truth w/out truth, law w/out law, duty w/out duty concentrated & lost in enigma of khrē, khrema, khraomai: one must, need, lack, desire, be indigent poor, owe, ought, need, utility, interest, thing, event, fatality, prayer

GT.content: natural debt, debt w/out debt > infinite debt

BL.content: quasi-event of the murder of father, event w/out event, resembles fiction, myth, fable > real, effective guilt; question of belief & historical referent—irremediably fissured
BL.linkedContent: quasi-event of the murder of father, event w/out event, resembles fiction, myth, fable > real, effective guilt; question of belief & historical referent—irremediably fissured

BL.content: dead father more powerful than living one
BL.linkedContent: dead father more powerful than living one

BL.content: truth w/out truth: Heidegger calls non-truth the truth of truth [I think elsewhere? Derrida doesn’t register Heidegger’s statement as equivalent to truth w/out truth]
BL.linkedContent: truth w/out truth: Heidegger calls non-truth the truth of truth [I think elsewhere? Derrida doesn’t register Heidegger’s statement as equivalent to truth w/out truth]

POO.content: [Derrida’s passion?]: the absolute solitude of a passion without martyrdom
POO.linkedContent: [Derrida’s passion?]: the absolute solitude of a passion without martyrdom

SPOM.content: the 2 experiences of the secret: I tell you that I cannot tell you > my 1st crime and 1st confession, a confession w/out confession
SPOM.linkedContent: the 2 experiences of the secret: I tell you that I cannot tell you > my 1st crime and 1st confession, a confession w/out confession

HASD.content: negative & hyperaffirmative meaning of without (sans) in St. Augustine
HASD.linkedContent: negative & hyperaffirmative meaning of without (sans) in St. Augustine

HASD.content: God is the Good that transcends the Good, the Being that transcends Being, this “logic” is that of the “without (sans)” > transcendence nothing other, and tout autre, than what it transcends [Augustine: God is powerful w/out power] [quoting w/out quoting]
HASD.linkedContent: God is the Good that transcends the Good, the Being that transcends Being, this “logic” is that of the “without (sans)” > transcendence nothing other, and tout autre, than what it transcends [Augustine: God is powerful w/out power] [quoting w/out quoting]

HASD.content: Heidegger w/ and w/out word “être” wrote a theology w/ and w/out God, left a trace no longer his own, mais qui reste quasiment la sienne > 3 adverbs: pas, sans, quasiment
HASD.linkedContent: Heidegger w/ and w/out word “être” wrote a theology w/ and w/out God, left a trace no longer his own, mais qui reste quasiment la sienne > 3 adverbs: pas, sans, quasiment

MPM.content: precipitousness, acceleration to win time, win time over, non-dialectical—not a particular rhythm—a rhythm w/out rhythm (incommensurable acceleration, infinite and null)
MPM.linkedContent: precipitousness, acceleration to win time, win time over, non-dialectical—not a particular rhythm—a rhythm w/out rhythm (incommensurable acceleration, infinite and null)

MPM.content: memory w/out memory (thinking memory); Gedächtnis w/out Erinnerung (symbolist introjection), not re-animated in the interiority of consciousness
MPM.linkedContent: memory w/out memory (thinking memory); Gedächtnis w/out Erinnerung (symbolist introjection), not re-animated in the interiority of consciousness

MPM.content: Gedächtnis [w/out Erinnerung], a thinking memory, engagement beyond negativity, a reaffirmation of engagement, a memory that has mourned the dialectic (which is mourning itself), memory w/out mourning, rigorous fidelity of an affirmation, barely “amnesic”
MPM.linkedContent: Gedächtnis [w/out Erinnerung], a thinking memory, engagement beyond negativity, a reaffirmation of engagement, a memory that has mourned the dialectic (which is mourning itself), memory w/out mourning, rigorous fidelity of an affirmation, barely “amnesic”

MPM.content: no act before speech, no speech before act > there is this not natural“fact,” faktum, to which we’re recalled: already there, past never present, historicity itself, “ancientness” w/out history
MPM.linkedContent: no act before speech, no speech before act > there is this not natural“fact,” faktum, to which we’re recalled: already there, past never present, historicity itself, “ancientness” w/out history

A.content: responsible decision must obey an “it is necessary” that owes nothing, owes nothing in order to be a duty, duty w/out debt, thus w/out duty
A.linkedContent: responsible decision must obey an “it is necessary” that owes nothing, owes nothing in order to be a duty, duty w/out debt, thus w/out duty

A.content: we can never say these are the conditions of inexhaustible singularity of event, must speak in negative form (w/out X no Y) [Derrida against present or presentation of “this is that”]
A.linkedContent: we can never say these are the conditions of inexhaustible singularity of event, must speak in negative form (w/out X no Y) [Derrida against present or presentation of “this is that”]

A.content: existential analysis as witness, belonging w/out belonging of testimony, and first of all to language
A.linkedContent: existential analysis as witness, belonging w/out belonging of testimony, and first of all to language

P(I).content: la force de hantise [that drives Derrida to Blanchot or Blanchot to Blanchot], injunction of a truth w/out truth, toujours au-delà de la fascination dont on parle à leur sujet > fascination de la loi, ce qui semble inimaginable, ou inconcevable, sinon impensable
P(I).linkedContent: la force de hantise [that drives Derrida to Blanchot or Blanchot to Blanchot], injunction of a truth w/out truth, toujours au-delà de la fascination dont on parle à leur sujet > fascination de la loi, ce qui semble inimaginable, ou inconcevable, sinon impensable

PAS.content: for Blanchot, proximity as an inclusion w/out interiority
PAS.linkedContent: for Blanchot, proximity as an inclusion w/out interiority

PAS.content: Blanchot’s Heidegger-like fissure that holds together, separation w/out separation, maintenance (nowness) w/out maintenance (nowness), Blanchot’s syntactical use of sans keeps us under its attraction [pas too?]
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot’s Heidegger-like fissure that holds together, separation w/out separation, maintenance (nowness) w/out maintenance (nowness), Blanchot’s syntactical use of sans keeps us under its attraction [pas too?]

PAS.content: law w/out law of é-loignement: not essence, but impossible topic of essentiality
PAS.linkedContent: law w/out law of é-loignement: not essence, but impossible topic of essentiality

PAS.content: play (w/out play) of the w/out (sans) disarticulates every identity, every contradiction > ever since the “the name of death” or nonidentity of double in the name
PAS.linkedContent: play (w/out play) of the w/out (sans) disarticulates every identity, every contradiction > ever since the “the name of death” or nonidentity of double in the name

PAS.content: (transgressive, completely passive) pas enacts a crossing of border that leaves border unscathed (indemne): bord sans bord, w/out any dialectical reappropriation
PAS.linkedContent: (transgressive, completely passive) pas enacts a crossing of border that leaves border unscathed (indemne): bord sans bord, w/out any dialectical reappropriation

PAS.content: “écriture comme trace d’un mouvement sans origin, sans fin, sans langage, sans…”
PAS.linkedContent: “écriture comme trace d’un mouvement sans origin, sans fin, sans langage, sans…”

PAS.content: [list of Blanchot’s many sans constructions] X sans X forms the trace or the pas of the toute autre that acts on itself there (s’y agit) > degree o (eau); il reste un reste sans reste de ce passage (il y a —pas—rien, un texte, un récit, déjà)
PAS.linkedContent: [list of Blanchot’s many sans constructions] X sans X forms the trace or the pas of the toute autre that acts on itself there (s’y agit) > degree o (eau); il reste un reste sans reste de ce passage (il y a —pas—rien, un texte, un récit, déjà)

PAS.content: formulation of sans is impossible; sheltered (abrité) by paleonym w/out relation to it, invests paleonym w/ tout autre > sans—trace de pas
PAS.linkedContent: formulation of sans is impossible; sheltered (abrité) by paleonym w/out relation to it, invests paleonym w/ tout autre > sans—trace de pas

PAS.content: sans remarks same X w/out annulling it, springless spring (ce ressort sans ressort), this re-trait leaves everything intact (sauf, indemne) in appearance [absolute heterogenous neutrality w/out negation], at the same time it has abducted, erased, absolute rapidity of dispossession (dérapage)
PAS.linkedContent: sans remarks same X w/out annulling it, springless spring (ce ressort sans ressort), this re-trait leaves everything intact (sauf, indemne) in appearance [absolute heterogenous neutrality w/out negation], at the same time it has abducted, erased, absolute rapidity of dispossession (dérapage)

PAS.content: sans is infinitely passive to tout autre that approaches it, sans auto-affects itself by tout autre
PAS.linkedContent: sans is infinitely passive to tout autre that approaches it, sans auto-affects itself by tout autre

PAS.content: death as the impossibility of dying, à partir de laquelle s’annonce la mort sans mort
PAS.linkedContent: death as the impossibility of dying, à partir de laquelle s’annonce la mort sans mort

POOF.content: Derrida countersigns Nietzsche [re: arrivant thinkers, new philosophers], extends the duty to countersign again, to us, to me, to you, teleiopoetically: friendship w/out friendship of friends of solitude
POOF.linkedContent: Derrida countersigns Nietzsche [re: arrivant thinkers, new philosophers], extends the duty to countersign again, to us, to me, to you, teleiopoetically: friendship w/out friendship of friends of solitude

POOF.content: language of madness, forced by most rigorous & profound necessity to say the insane, impossible, absurd, undecidable—to the disdain of philosophical good conscience (wants to hold out in shade of the Enlightenment): every “X without X” [i.e. “community w/out community”]
POOF.linkedContent: language of madness, forced by most rigorous & profound necessity to say the insane, impossible, absurd, undecidable—to the disdain of philosophical good conscience (wants to hold out in shade of the Enlightenment): every “X without X” [i.e. “community w/out community”]

POOF.content: we tremble in time of Nietzsche’s mutation, we belong (w/out belonging) to this tremor, absolute dislocation, borderless disjoining; we emit warnings, like searchlights w/out coast, mad, impossible pleas: recurrent syntagms of “X without X” (harbor invisible in their very light) > are these watchmen [Bataille, Blanchot, Nancy] guiding us toward another destination [?]
POOF.linkedContent: we tremble in time of Nietzsche’s mutation, we belong (w/out belonging) to this tremor, absolute dislocation, borderless disjoining; we emit warnings, like searchlights w/out coast, mad, impossible pleas: recurrent syntagms of “X without X” (harbor invisible in their very light) > are these watchmen [Bataille, Blanchot, Nancy] guiding us toward another destination [?]

POOF.content: gravest of problems, not our intention to denounce fraternity: via Michelet, fraternity as ‘law beyond law,’ vision of universal/revolutionary fraternity [à la the Enlightenment], a hyperbole whose generosity can’t be opposed > [Derrida promising] a fraternity w/out fraternity (literal, strict, genealogical, masculine)
POOF.linkedContent: gravest of problems, not our intention to denounce fraternity: via Michelet, fraternity as ‘law beyond law,’ vision of universal/revolutionary fraternity [à la the Enlightenment], a hyperbole whose generosity can’t be opposed > [Derrida promising] a fraternity w/out fraternity (literal, strict, genealogical, masculine)

POOF.content: Zarathustra always called us, supposing it teleiopoetically, under neutral, non-dialecticizable law of pas and ‘X w/out X’
POOF.linkedContent: Zarathustra always called us, supposing it teleiopoetically, under neutral, non-dialecticizable law of pas and ‘X w/out X’

POOF.content: this friendship announced would have nothing to do w/ community: so that each X without X, unceasing neutralization of one predicate by another (relation w/out relation, community w/out community, partage sans partage), would call on significations altogether different from part shared or held in common
POOF.linkedContent: this friendship announced would have nothing to do w/ community: so that each X without X, unceasing neutralization of one predicate by another (relation w/out relation, community w/out community, partage sans partage), would call on significations altogether different from part shared or held in common

P.content: Derrida’s pas in Hegel/Heidegger’s circle, get across (franchir) circle w/out getting free (s’affranchir), pas sans pas: circular closure as one that remains open
P.linkedContent: Derrida’s pas in Hegel/Heidegger’s circle, get across (franchir) circle w/out getting free (s’affranchir), pas sans pas: circular closure as one that remains open

P.content: for Kant, beauty is universality w/out concept—necessitates an analogy, occupation of nonconceptual field by the grid (quadrillage) of conceptual force: sans et avec [concept] en même temps (ama)
P.linkedContent: for Kant, beauty is universality w/out concept—necessitates an analogy, occupation of nonconceptual field by the grid (quadrillage) of conceptual force: sans et avec [concept] en même temps (ama)

P.content: but en blanc [cf. C p. 229 can(n)on] (gun as finality w/out end in sight) [goal as white page] Kant’s finality w/out end: free beauty, wild tulip
P.linkedContent: but en blanc [cf. C p. 229 can(n)on] (gun as finality w/out end in sight) [goal as white page] Kant’s finality w/out end: free beauty, wild tulip

P.content: tulip is exemplary of the sans of the pure cut (sans of finality-sans-end)
P.linkedContent: tulip is exemplary of the sans of the pure cut (sans of finality-sans-end)

P.content: “on this sans, that is not a lack, science has nothing to say”
P.linkedContent: “on this sans, that is not a lack, science has nothing to say”

P.content: beautiful object, tulip, not lacking in anything, tel point de vue, de but en blanc, plie la totalité à se manquer elle-même > le sans de la coupure pure est sans manque—but for me to experience its totality, my knowledge lacks something—its end (bout); not the absence of end but the trace of the without [end] is origin of beauty; ça donne-le-beau: beauty gives nothing to be seen, sans is not visible, et pourtant il y en a et c’est beau
P.linkedContent: beautiful object, tulip, not lacking in anything, tel point de vue, de but en blanc, plie la totalité à se manquer elle-même > le sans de la coupure pure est sans manque—but for me to experience its totality, my knowledge lacks something—its end (bout); not the absence of end but the trace of the without [end] is origin of beauty; ça donne-le-beau: beauty gives nothing to be seen, sans is not visible, et pourtant il y en a et c’est beau

P.content: nonknowledge is point of view whose irreducibility gives rise to the beautiful (purity of the trace of the sans) > Kant: no science of the beautiful, only critique
P.linkedContent: nonknowledge is point of view whose irreducibility gives rise to the beautiful (purity of the trace of the sans) > Kant: no science of the beautiful, only critique

P.content: concepts stitch up (recoudre), furnish supplement of adherence [re: completes incomplete gadget]; still, there’s a chiasma, w/ free beauty, la coupure n’y laisse aucune peau, aucun tissu d’adhérence: law w/out concept, w/out debt, complete because incomplete
P.linkedContent: concepts stitch up (recoudre), furnish supplement of adherence [re: completes incomplete gadget]; still, there’s a chiasma, w/ free beauty, la coupure n’y laisse aucune peau, aucun tissu d’adhérence: law w/out concept, w/out debt, complete because incomplete

P.content: concept: a saturating generality—drinks up or effaces sans of pure cut
P.linkedContent: concept: a saturating generality—drinks up or effaces sans of pure cut

P.content: “negative pleasure” of sublime, respect, admiration, is different from “positive pleasure” of beautiful, and unique from beauty’s negativity (the work of of mourning in beauty), which was already singular, a negativity w/out negativity, sans sans sans, sans of pure cut, sans fin of finality [Blanchot’s awaiting oblivion vs. Levinas’ face-to-face?]
P.linkedContent: “negative pleasure” of sublime, respect, admiration, is different from “positive pleasure” of beautiful, and unique from beauty’s negativity (the work of of mourning in beauty), which was already singular, a negativity w/out negativity, sans sans sans, sans of pure cut, sans fin of finality [Blanchot’s awaiting oblivion vs. Levinas’ face-to-face?]

ROP.content: la restance disséminale, hyperbolythique, destined (vouée) to chance, to ash, à un oubli radical, trace w/out trace: secret w/out depth, lieu, nom, destination, lysis w/out measure/return/anagogy
ROP.linkedContent: la restance disséminale, hyperbolythique, destined (vouée) to chance, to ash, à un oubli radical, trace w/out trace: secret w/out depth, lieu, nom, destination, lysis w/out measure/return/anagogy

ATIA.content: contretemps of 2 nudities w/out nudity: 1) animal in non-nudity because nude 2) man in nudity so no longer nude
ATIA.linkedContent: contretemps of 2 nudities w/out nudity: 1) animal in non-nudity because nude 2) man in nudity so no longer nude

O.content: [re: Maldoror’s 6th song, exit into the real] spider w/out web to spin, instant of awakening, instant of death
O.linkedContent: [re: Maldoror’s 6th song, exit into the real] spider w/out web to spin, instant of awakening, instant of death

SW.content: expecting w/out knowing, thus w/out expecting [?]
SW.linkedContent: expecting w/out knowing, thus w/out expecting [?]

SW.content: [read Cixous’ Savoir] only in a French to come, only happen in delayed form—inheriting w/out inheriting, reinventing mother & father [baby daddy]
SW.linkedContent: [read Cixous’ Savoir] only in a French to come, only happen in delayed form—inheriting w/out inheriting, reinventing mother & father [baby daddy]

DPi.content: time of bandages: when body not found—when Jesus is not dead but not yet elevated, resuscitated > the lodging made ready for literature: ascension w/out ascension, elevation w/out elevation, immanence w/out immanence, imminent yet unaccomplished resurrection
DPi.linkedContent: time of bandages: when body not found—when Jesus is not dead but not yet elevated, resuscitated > the lodging made ready for literature: ascension w/out ascension, elevation w/out elevation, immanence w/out immanence, imminent yet unaccomplished resurrection

DPi.content: instant of bandages, Christ’s being-there w/out being-there: this Dasein that is not a Da-sein, this Fort/Da-sein of Christ who’s dead but not dead, mort vivant
DPi.linkedContent: instant of bandages, Christ’s being-there w/out being-there: this Dasein that is not a Da-sein, this Fort/Da-sein of Christ who’s dead but not dead, mort vivant

DPi.content: [vis-à-vis Blanchot] literature “expresses w/out expressing,” “this death w/out death” defines horizon w/out horizon of responsibility w/out responsibility of writer
DPi.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Blanchot] literature “expresses w/out expressing,” “this death w/out death” defines horizon w/out horizon of responsibility w/out responsibility of writer

REST.content: in “I owe you the truth in painting,” emphasis should be placed on the owe (doit), the debt, il doit, “he must/should/owes/ought”: vérité sans vérité de la vérité
REST.linkedContent: in “I owe you the truth in painting,” emphasis should be placed on the owe (doit), the debt, il doit, “he must/should/owes/ought”: vérité sans vérité de la vérité

DST.content: for Lacoue-Labarthe, mimesis is an essence w/out essence, is not, does not exist—desists (not negative)
DST.linkedContent: for Lacoue-Labarthe, mimesis is an essence w/out essence, is not, does not exist—desists (not negative)

AFR.content: via Condillac, desire no longer a direction, but an end w/out end > moment stone (statue) comes to life, works to reduce gap, (not) become dead again—contrary to frivolous distraction, to headstrong identity of signs: fear of Medusa [fear of frivolous?], legitimacy itself
AFR.linkedContent: via Condillac, desire no longer a direction, but an end w/out end > moment stone (statue) comes to life, works to reduce gap, (not) become dead again—contrary to frivolous distraction, to headstrong identity of signs: fear of Medusa [fear of frivolous?], legitimacy itself

C.content: how can we delimit all the features (traits) [of artwork] when the absent one haunts, obsesses, besieges (assiège) [plus qu’un autre] > avec égale sans (trait d’union: with-out [in English])
C.linkedContent: how can we delimit all the features (traits) [of artwork] when the absent one haunts, obsesses, besieges (assiège) [plus qu’un autre] > avec égale sans (trait d’union: with-out [in English])

EL.content: desert, verge of the abyss, place w/out place (lieu sans lieu), improbable border
EL.linkedContent: desert, verge of the abyss, place w/out place (lieu sans lieu), improbable border

EL.content: does Scholem want shibboleth to get out of abyss (the improbable border, the desert) or to rush into it & be engulfed by it (pour s’y engouffrer)?
EL.linkedContent: does Scholem want shibboleth to get out of abyss (the improbable border, the desert) or to rush into it & be engulfed by it (pour s’y engouffrer)?

TN.content: tôt (soon): d’avance dévoré par cet autre du temps, consumed, burned, tostus refers to instant, au temps sans temps d’une flamme > on the verge, it’s the end: no time for motion, trop tard
TN.linkedContent: tôt (soon): d’avance dévoré par cet autre du temps, consumed, burned, tostus refers to instant, au temps sans temps d’une flamme > on the verge, it’s the end: no time for motion, trop tard

TN.content: Nancy remains an exacting, rigorous, philosopher where limits tremble (impossible, undecidable), trembles w/out trembling, submits to trembling
TN.linkedContent: Nancy remains an exacting, rigorous, philosopher where limits tremble (impossible, undecidable), trembles w/out trembling, submits to trembling

TN.content: this equivocation [re: Levinas’ caress] of negation w/out negativity marked by recurrence of “as if” and “without” (x w/out x, “essence of this non-essence”)
TN.linkedContent: this equivocation [re: Levinas’ caress] of negation w/out negativity marked by recurrence of “as if” and “without” (x w/out x, “essence of this non-essence”)

TN.content: Derrida jokingly scolds himself for scolding Nancy: stop using this incredible vocabulary > abstain from ‘touching,’ ce concept sans répondant assuré: figures w/out figure, therefore w/out credit
TN.linkedContent: Derrida jokingly scolds himself for scolding Nancy: stop using this incredible vocabulary > abstain from ‘touching,’ ce concept sans répondant assuré: figures w/out figure, therefore w/out credit

TN.content: de Biran, faculty of movement: “willing subject,” twinning (jumeler) the stem (souche): ego w/out ego before ego—1) touch as motor will 2) touch as pure sensibility > combines thinking of force w/ thinking of virtual [p. 136]
TN.linkedContent: de Biran, faculty of movement: “willing subject,” twinning (jumeler) the stem (souche): ego w/out ego before ego—1) touch as motor will 2) touch as pure sensibility > combines thinking of force w/ thinking of virtual [p. 136]

TN.content: pudeur: elle déploie ses voiles à l'infini > must must not, because can can’t (confess/betray)
TN.linkedContent: pudeur: elle déploie ses voiles à l'infini > must must not, because can can’t (confess/betray)

TN.content: la loi marque ainsi le sans dan le sens ou dans l’existence ——a “must (devoir)” worthy (digne) of the name must remain foreign to an economy of debt [w/out alibi]
TN.linkedContent: la loi marque ainsi le sans dan le sens ou dans l’existence ——a “must (devoir)” worthy (digne) of the name must remain foreign to an economy of debt [w/out alibi]

E.content: [re: disinterested pleasure] a moral revenue drawn from a natural production w/out interest to us; one takes wealth w/out interest, the singular moral surplus value of sans—still, the trace (Spur) of a purpose in nature is what makes our stock in moral value rise
E.linkedContent: [re: disinterested pleasure] a moral revenue drawn from a natural production w/out interest to us; one takes wealth w/out interest, the singular moral surplus value of sans—still, the trace (Spur) of a purpose in nature is what makes our stock in moral value rise

E.content: the without of pure detachment is a language nature speaks to us, “she who loves to encrypt herself and record her signature on things”
E.linkedContent: the without of pure detachment is a language nature speaks to us, “she who loves to encrypt herself and record her signature on things”

LG.content: trait (supplementary & distinctive), re-mark of belonging doesn’t belong, this sans > a blink of the eye, w/out which nothing would come to light
LG.linkedContent: trait (supplementary & distinctive), re-mark of belonging doesn’t belong, this sans > a blink of the eye, w/out which nothing would come to light

LG.content: genre-clause (clause de genre): clin d’oeil, écluse (floodgate), clôture qui s’exclut de ce qu’elle inclut, déclasse ce qu’elle permet de classer > unfigurable figure of clusion, forme sans forme, neither sees day nor brings itself to light
LG.linkedContent: genre-clause (clause de genre): clin d’oeil, écluse (floodgate), clôture qui s’exclut de ce qu’elle inclut, déclasse ce qu’elle permet de classer > unfigurable figure of clusion, forme sans forme, neither sees day nor brings itself to light

ATAP.content: apocalypse w/out apocalypse, w/out Last Judgment, no eschatology beyond tone of “Come” itself > the apocalypse of apocalypse [our apocalypse now], beyond good & evil: no longer collection of evil & good in legein of alētheia, in Geschick of l’envoi, or of Schicken of co-destination
ATAP.linkedContent: apocalypse w/out apocalypse, w/out Last Judgment, no eschatology beyond tone of “Come” itself > the apocalypse of apocalypse [our apocalypse now], beyond good & evil: no longer collection of evil & good in legein of alētheia, in Geschick of l’envoi, or of Schicken of co-destination

ATAP.content: [apocalypse w/out apocalypse] X w/out X, sans marks internal/external catastrophe of apocalypse, catastrophe of sans doesn’t merge w/ announced end, is its pli: a closure w/out end, end w/out end > outside of apocalypse w/in apocalypse
ATAP.linkedContent: [apocalypse w/out apocalypse] X w/out X, sans marks internal/external catastrophe of apocalypse, catastrophe of sans doesn’t merge w/ announced end, is its pli: a closure w/out end, end w/out end > outside of apocalypse w/in apocalypse

ATAP.content: “do not seal”: i.e. do not close, do not sign
ATAP.linkedContent: “do not seal”: i.e. do not close, do not sign

EU.content: Derrida admits to abusing word strategy, always stratégie sans finalité, au risque de me couper l’herbe sous les pieds > car j’y tiens et elle me tient > aleatory strategy: someone who admits he doesn’t know where he’s going > also comme la précipitation sans détour vers la fin, joyous contradiction of self: very old and cunning (rusée), something that’s just been born, delights in being w/out defense
EU.linkedContent: Derrida admits to abusing word strategy, always stratégie sans finalité, au risque de me couper l’herbe sous les pieds > car j’y tiens et elle me tient > aleatory strategy: someone who admits he doesn’t know where he’s going > also comme la précipitation sans détour vers la fin, joyous contradiction of self: very old and cunning (rusée), something that’s just been born, delights in being w/out defense

SPEC.content: where Causa is l’Autre Chose—no more opposition btwn pleasure & unpleasure, w/in & beyond, life & death: graphics of strictural supplement not oppositional, knowns no negation, no lack > in this graphics, desire is sans “sans,” is of a “sans sans sans”
